acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from ErC50=20microg/L of the algae (Green Algae) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data, 2004).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (dermal route) value of >6,590mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1983)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Classification cannot be determined, though the available rat inhalation study reported the LC50 value of >0.809mg/L (4 hours) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1983)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is a solid according to the GHS criteria and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 306mg/kg (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1983)).

carcinogenicity.rationale: There was no treatment-related increase in tumor incidence observed in carcinogenicity studies in rats and mice (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1983, 1996)).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (log Kow=2.22(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), since there was no rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), it was classified into Category 1.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances with melting point of >55degC are not available (melting point: 167-169degC (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data)). Assigned to Division 6.1 (UN#2763 Triazine Pesticide, solid, toxic (ICSC (2004))) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on negative data in in vitro assays (reverse mutation tests, chromosome aberration tests and unscheduled DNA synthesis tests) and in vivo assays (mouse chromosome aberration tests, dominant lethal tests and unscheduled DNA synthesis tests) (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1983, 1996, 1997)).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing chlorine (but not oxygen and fluorine), with the chlorine bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on no evidence of adverse effects on reproduction or offspring development observed in rat 3-generation reproduction studies and rat/rabbit teratogenicity studies (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1983)).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (PATTY (4th, 1999)): "Mild to moderate irritation" and "severe irritation following instillation of 90% formulation, which took about two weeks to resolve." The substance is thus considered a moderate irritant.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (24 hours, occluded) (PATTY (4th, 1999)): "Mildly irritating."

skin_sensitizer.rationale: No skin sensitizing potential was found in guinea pig sensitization tests employing the Buehler method (Agricultural Chemical Registration Data (1998)).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (kidney, heart)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "acute renal failure, acute renal tubular necrosis, and myocardiosis including myocardial infarction" (RTECS (2003)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1 (kidneys) and Category 2 (heart). Since the referenced study (RTECS (2003)) is assigned a priority rating of 2, these effects are classified into Category 2.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "lethargy" (RTECS (2003)).
